Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hylin PL (XXA; UCLL1c; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretions, the banana tree dwelling frog,Boana platanera(Hylidae; Hylinae), Trinidad, South America

Literature Information.Literature:
Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (78.95%) tofrog Hylin-Pul3L: 24%; A=G: 18%. GRAVY: 1.57; mol Wt: 1681.096; mol formula: C81H138N18O19; mol ex coeff: 0.Activity: weakly active against E. coli DSM 787 (MIC 100 ug/ml), S. aureus
ATCC 43300 (MIC 100 ug/ml),  S-epidermidis DSM 28319 (MIC >100 ug/ml), P-aeruginosa DSM 50071 (MIC >100 ug/ml), K-pneumoniae ATCC BAA 1705 (MIC >100 ug/ml), A. baumannii DSM 30008 (MIC 100 ug/ml),  E. faecalis MF 06036 (MIC 100 ug/ml), E. faecium NCTC 12201 (MIC 50 ug/ml), C. difficile R20291 or 630 BAA1382 (MIC 25-50 ug/ml).affected multiple Cancer cells A549, MDA-MB-231, HT-29: LC50 58-68 ug/ml similar to non-cancer cells, lack of selectivity.In addition, this peptide promotes insulin secretion in acute 20-min incubations with glucose responsive BRIN-BD11 cells, thereby of interest for type 2 diabetes (T2D).
Literature Information.Author: Conlon JM, Sridhar A, Khan D, Cunning TS, Delaney JJ, Taggart MG, Ternan NG, Leprince J, Coquet L, Jouenne T, Attoub S, Mechkarska M. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Multifunctional host-defense peptides isolated from skin secretions of the banana tree dwelling frog Boana platanera (Hylidae; Hylinae).
